verses.text: Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

And may the grace of God the Father, whose throne is high in the heavens, and our Lord Jesus Christ, who sitteth on the right hand of his power, until all things shall become subject unto him, be, and abide with you forever. Amen.
To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Unto Timothy, my own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.
And this according to the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, to whom be all glory, both now and forever. Amen.
Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
Grace be with you all. Amen.
And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,
Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Now God himself and our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way unto you.
We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:
Then said Jesus to them again, Peace be unto you: as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you.
Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:
The Lord our God be with us, as he was with our fathers: let him not leave us, nor forsake us:

And now, I would commend you to seek this Jesus of whom the prophets and apostles have written, that the grace of God the Father, and also the Lord Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost, which beareth record of them, may be and abide in you forever. Amen.
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

And now, may the peace of God rest upon you, and upon your houses and lands, and upon your flocks and herds, and all that you possess, your women and your children, according to your faith and good works, from this time forth and forever. And thus I have spoken. Amen.
Glory, and honor, and power, and might,Be ascribed to our God; for he is full of mercy,Justice, grace and truth, and peace,Forever and ever, Amen.

I am mindful of you always in my prayers, continually praying unto God the Father in the name of his Holy Child, Jesus, that he, through his infinite goodness and grace, will keep you through the endurance of faith on his name to the end.
Mercy unto you, and peace, and love, be multiplied.
And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.
But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.
So that I come again to my father's house in peace; then shall the Lord be my God:

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:

similars.text: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
Ye are blessed of the Lord which made heaven and earth.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
One God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in you all.
Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,
Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
And hath made us kings and priests unto God and his Father; to him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.

And may the grace of God the Father, whose throne is high in the heavens, and our Lord Jesus Christ, who sitteth on the right hand of his power, until all things shall become subject unto him, be, and abide with you forever. Amen.
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Whose are the fathers, and of whom as concerning the flesh Christ came, who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen.
We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
But to us there is but one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom are all things, and we by him.
The Lord hath done great things for us; whereof we are glad.
He shall receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, be with you all. Amen.
Blessed be the Lord God of our fathers, which hath put such a thing as this in the king's heart, to beautify the house of the Lord which is in Jerusalem:
Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

And may the grace of God the Father, whose throne is high in the heavens, and our Lord Jesus Christ, who sitteth on the right hand of his power, until all things shall become subject unto him, be, and abide with you forever. Amen.
We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,
Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him:
And hath raised us up together, and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus:

verses.text: According as he hath chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:

similars.text: In holiness and righteousness before him, all the days of our life.
Who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,
Who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,

verses.text: Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,

similars.text: Having made known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he hath purposed in himself:
In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will:
According to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:

verses.text: To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.

similars.text: That we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ.
His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.
But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
Now therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy glorious name.
For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.
Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.
By whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:
When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.
For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

But let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understandeth and knoweth me, that I am the Lord which exercise lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith the Lord.
And the grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

verses.text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace;

similars.text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, even the forgiveness of sins:
Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;
Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.
In whom we have redemption through his blood, even the forgiveness of sins:
In whom we have redemption through his blood, even the forgiveness of sins:

verses.text: Wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

similars.text: But behold, all things have been done in the wisdom of him who knoweth all things.
Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.
According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:
And he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;

verses.text: Having made known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he hath purposed in himself:

similars.text: To whom he grants this privilege of seeing and knowing for themselves;
Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,
According to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:
In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will:

verses.text: That in the dispensation of the fulness of times he might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; even in him:

similars.text: Unto whom I have committed the keys of my kingdom, and a dispensation of the gospel for the last times; and for the fulness of times, in the which I will gather together in one all things, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth;

Unto whom I have committed the keys of my kingdom, and a dispensation of the gospel for the last times; and for the fulness of times, in the which I will gather together in one all things, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth;

verses.text: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will:

similars.text: For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.
Which is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of his glory.
Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.
And also, this is a law unto every man that cometh unto this land to receive an inheritance; and he shall do with his moneys according as the law directs.
Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,
Having made known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he hath purposed in himself:

verses.text: That we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ.

similars.text: For our heart shall rejoice in him, because we have trusted in his holy name.
To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.
The righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
O taste and see that the Lord is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
When he shall come to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired in all them that believe (because our testimony among you was believed) in that day.
For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.

verses.text: In whom ye also trusted, after that ye heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that ye believed, ye were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,

similars.text: And they that heard it said, Who then can be saved?
And who overcome by faith, and are sealed by the Holy Spirit of promise, which the Father sheds forth upon all those who are just and true.
For the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, whereof ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel;

verses.text: Which is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of his glory.

similars.text: Behold, I say, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of thy possession, which thou hast given us to inherit.
Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.
And it shall be, when thou art come in unto the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee for an inheritance, and possessest it, and dwellest therein;
In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will:

verses.text: Wherefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus, and love unto all the saints,

similars.text: Since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love which ye have to all the saints,
Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
Since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love which ye have to all the saints,
Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

verses.text: Cease not to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers;

similars.text: We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;
I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;

verses.text: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him:

similars.text: For behold, to one is given by the Spirit of God, that he may teach the word of wisdom;
That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;
I give unto you these sayings that you may understand and know how to worship, and know what you worship, that you may come unto the Father in my name, and in due time receive of his fulness.
Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,

And we know that the Son of God is come, and hath given us an understanding, that we may know him that is true, and we are in him that is true, even in his Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God, and eternal life.

And do thou grant, Holy Father, that all those who shall worship in this house may be taught words of wisdom out of the best books, and that they may seek learning even by study, and also by faith, as thou hast said;
God shall give unto you knowledge by his Holy Spirit, yea, by the unspeakable gift of the Holy Ghost, that has not been revealed since the world was until now;

And when ye shall receive these things, I would exhort you that ye would ask God, the Eternal Father, in the name of Christ, if these things are not true; and if ye shall ask with a sincere heart, with real intent, having faith in Christ, he will manifest the truth of it unto you, by the power of the Holy Ghost.

For behold, the Spirit of Christ is given to every man, that he may know good from evil; wherefore, I show unto you the way to judge; for every thing which inviteth to do good, and to persuade to believe in Christ, is sent forth by the power and gift of Christ; wherefore ye may know with a perfect knowledge it is of God.
That through the power and manifestation of the Spirit, while in the flesh, they may be able to bear his presence in the world of glory.
And to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge, that ye might be filled with all the fulness of God.

And also that ye might know of the coming of Jesus Christ, the Son of God, the Father of heaven and of earth, the Creator of all things from the beginning; and that ye might know of the signs of his coming, to the intent that ye might believe on his name.
To whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:

If thou shalt ask, thou shalt receive revelation upon revelation, knowledge upon knowledge, that thou mayest know the mysteries and peaceable things--that which bringeth joy, that which bringeth life eternal.
God shall give unto you knowledge by his Holy Spirit, yea, by the unspeakable gift of the Holy Ghost, that has not been revealed since the world was until now;
That the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,
For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that ye might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:
To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen.

verses.text: The eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that ye may know what is the hope of his calling, and what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,

similars.text: To whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:

verses.text: And what is the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe, according to the working of his mighty power,

similars.text: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,
Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.
Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.
And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lord be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
I say unto you, what is it, that thy marvelings are so great? Behold, I am a man, and am thy servant; therefore, whatsoever thou desirest which is right, that will I do.
O Lord God, thou hast begun to shew thy servant thy greatness, and thy mighty hand: for what God is there in heaven or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy might?
Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,

verses.text: Which he wrought in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and set him at his own right hand in the heavenly places,

similars.text: And hath raised us up together, and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus:

verses.text: Far above all principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come:
And hath put all things under his feet, and gave him to be the head over all things to the church,

similars.text: For he hath put all things under his feet. But when he saith all things are put under him, it is manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.
Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all things under his feet:
Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing that is not put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.
For he hath put all things under his feet. But when he saith all things are put under him, it is manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.
Thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet. For in that he put all in subjection under him, he left nothing that is not put under him. But now we see not yet all things put under him.

verses.text: Which is his body, the fulness of him that filleth all in all.

similars.text: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.
For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.
For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.
For it pleased the Father that in him should all fulness dwell;
